snippet: Although the city has replenished the positions it lost during the 2008 recession, a recent report shows that organized labor has not bounced back.
abstract: Report by scholars at the City University of New York shows that the number of city residents with union jobs in the private sector has dropped by nearly 20 percent since the recession started in 2008; steep decline may signal a lasting erosion of one of the few remaining bastions of union power
lead_paragraph: Although the city has replenished the positions it lost during the 2008 recession, a recent report shows that organized labor has not bounced back.

headline.seo: Union Jobs in Private Sector Plummet in New York
headline.main: Union Jobs Plummet in the Private Sector
headline.print_headline: Union Jobs Plummet in the Private Sector
